SENT.plain: BACKGROUND AND PURPOSE: We report a case of facial diplegia complicating a bilateral internal carotid artery dissection
CASE DESCRIPTION: A 49-year-old patient presented with unilateral headache and oculosympathetic paresis
Cerebral angiography revealed a bilateral internal carotid artery dissection
A few days later, the patient developed a facial diplegia that regressed after arterial recanalization
An arterial anatomic variation may explain this ischemic complication of carotid dissection
CONCLUSIONS: Double carotid dissection should be included among the causes of bilateral seventh nerve palsy
